intro: Helichrysum ledifolium subsp. reflexum, commonly known as the silverleaf helichrysum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a woolly texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
